title: Abstract
h2: Any value of a physical quantity, in a given unit of measurement ( Abstract )

td.code: AbstractType : Abstract<Q, Child, T, P, N>
Abstract(const Abstract<Q, Child, T, P1, N>& rhs)
Abstract(const Abstract<Q1, C1, T1, P1, N1>& rhs)

operator=(const Abstract<Q1, C1, T1, P1, N1>& rhs)
operator+=(const Abstract<Q, Child, T, P1, N>& rhs)
operator+=(const Abstract<Q1, C1, T1, P1, N1>& rhs)

operator!=(const Abstract<Q1, C1, T1, P1, N1>& rhs) const

div.code: + AbstractType: typedef Abstract<Q, Child, T, P, N>;

div.b: Copy Constructor (from the same unit of measurement)
div.code: template<typename P1 > + Abstract: (const Abstract<Q, Child, T, P1, N>& rhs);

ul.li: P1 Any precision, which will change nothing in this case

div.code: template<class Q1 , typename T1 , class C1 , typename P1 , typename N1 > + Abstract: (const Abstract<Q1, C1, T1, P1, N1>& rhs);

ul.li: P1 Any precision associated to the ratio N1/M1
N1 The nominator of the ration N1/M1
M1 The denominator of the ration N1/M1

div.b: Symbol used for the Unit of measurement (may be empty)
Name of the Unit of measurement.
